articles.headline: Trump, in Interview, Moderates Views but Defies Conventions
articles.snippet: In a discussion at The New York Times, the president-elect was less adamant on prosecuting Hillary Clinton, the use of waterboarding and climate change.
articles.abstract: In a discussion at The New York Times, the president-elect was less adamant on prosecuting Hillary Clinton, the use of waterboarding and climate change.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump on Tuesday tempered some of his most extreme campaign promises, dropping his vow to jail Hillary Clinton, expressing doubt about the value of torturing terrorism suspects and pledging to have an open mind about climate change.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Facebook Said to Create Censorship Tool to Get Back Into China
articles.snippet: The social network, blocked in China since 2009, has developed software to keep posts from appearing in users’ news feeds in specific geographic areas, current and former employees said.
articles.abstract: The social network, blocked in China since 2009, has developed software to keep posts from appearing in users’ news feeds in specific geographic areas, current and former employees said.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook’s chief executive, has cultivated relationships with China’s leaders, including President Xi Jinping. He has paid multiple visits to the country to meet its top internet executives. He has made an effort to learn Mandarin.

articles.headline: Where Marijuana Is the Doctor’s Orders, Will Insurers Pay?
articles.snippet: As legal use of marijuana spreads, it has raised questions in the workplace, such as about drug tests and insurance coverage for medical use.
articles.abstract: As legal use of marijuana spreads, it has raised questions in the workplace, such as about drug tests and insurance coverage for medical use.
articles.lead_paragraph: Early this year, a disabled former automobile body worker named Greg Vialpando explained to lawmakers in New Mexico how medical marijuana helped his chronic back pain.

articles.headline: Auto Safety Regulators Seek a Driver Mode to Block Apps
articles.snippet: Voluntary guidelines will be issued amid a spike in traffic fatalities in the last two years.
articles.abstract: Voluntary guidelines will be issued amid a spike in traffic fatalities in the last two years.
articles.lead_paragraph: Apple iPhones and other hand-held devices have long had an airplane mode that shuts off wireless communications to prevent interference with the vast electronics systems that control modern aircraft.

articles.headline: After Obama Push for Clemency, Hints of Reversal Likely to Come
articles.snippet: Mr. Obama is on pace to be the first president since Lyndon B. Johnson to leave office with a federal prison population smaller than the one he inherited.
articles.abstract: Mr. Obama is on pace to be the first president since Lyndon B. Johnson to leave office with a federal prison population smaller than the one he inherited.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama is on pace to be the first president in decades to leave office with a federal prison population that is smaller than when he was sworn in, a reflection of eight years of liberal criminal justice policies, historically low crime rates and an aggressive use of presidential commutations.

articles.headline: Democrats’ Leadership Fight Pits West Wing Against Left Wing
articles.snippet: Representative Keith Ellison of Minnesota has been steadily adding endorsements, but some advisers to President Obama are urging others to enter the race.
articles.abstract: Representative Keith Ellison of Minnesota has been steadily adding endorsements, but some advisers to President Obama are urging others to enter the race.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Struggling to respond to Donald J. Trump’s victory, a group of shellshocked Democrats moved swiftly to endorse Representative Keith Ellison of Minnesota for chairman of the Democratic National Committee, hoping that he would be a fresh face for a party with a depleted bench.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Kochs and Other Madoff Investors Are Winners in Fight Over Profits Held Abroad
articles.snippet: A judge ruled that certain funds held abroad — estimated at about $2 billion — could not be made available to victims of the Madoff Ponzi scheme.
articles.abstract: A judge ruled that certain funds held abroad — estimated at about $2 billion — could not be made available to victims of the Madoff Ponzi scheme.
articles.lead_paragraph: The company led by the American billionaire Koch brothers, along with dozens of banks and fund managers, kept billions of dollars in profit from Bernard L. Madoff’s Ponzi scheme in accounts offshore. As it turns out, that was a good decision.

articles.headline: Two Children, One Rich, One Poor, Gasping for Air in Delhi’s Smog
articles.snippet: How two families at opposite ends of the economic spectrum were affected when a suffocating cloud of pollution settled over the city this month.
articles.abstract: How two families at opposite ends of the economic spectrum were affected when a suffocating cloud of pollution settled over the city this month.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — In the dense smog that engulfed India’s capital early this month, a baby named Vaishnavi gasped through the night.

articles.headline: Trump Diversifies Cabinet; Picks Nikki Haley and Betsy DeVos
articles.snippet: The president-elect’s first picks were white men, but now he has recruited two women: Gov. Nikki R. Haley of South Carolina and Betsy DeVos, a G.O.P. philanthropist.
articles.abstract: The president-elect’s first picks were white men, but now he has recruited two women: Gov. Nikki R. Haley of South Carolina and Betsy DeVos, a G.O.P. philanthropist.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump moved swiftly on Wednesday to diversify his cabinet and try to heal lingering rifts in the Republican Party, reaching out to Gov. Nikki R. Haley of South Carolina and Betsy DeVos, a prominent Republican fund-raiser, both of whom opposed him during the campaign, as well as Ben Carson, who challenged Mr. Trump for the Republican nomination.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Maggie Haberman
